intro: Phenax hirtus var. minor, commonly known as the hairy phenax, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
